New Records: Emmanuel Clase earned his AL-best 39th save — with his career-high 26th straight conversion — and matched Cody Allen’s franchise record with 149.
Key Match Events: Rookie Jhonkensy Noel singled home Josh Naylor with the go-ahead run in the seventh inning.
Bo Naylor homered off starter Michael Wacha.
Josh Naylor, Will Brennan and Noel had RBI singles against Lucas Erceg.
Andrés Giménez tacked on a sacrifice fly in the eighth.
Bobby Witt Jr., Vinnie Pasquantino and Michael Massey hit solo homers off Guardians ace Tanner Bibee.
Post-Match Reflections: Cleveland manager Stephen Vogt said, 'We haven’t looked like ourselves for a while, but that inning, that was us. It was such a great response by our guys.'

Royals first baseman Vinnie Pasquantino said, 'Tough way for us to go out, but we came in here and did what we needed to do. I think we have their respect and they have ours. It’s going to be a fun month.'

Bo Naylor said, 'The competitive nature Clase attacks the game with and the mentality he goes out with, it’s huge having him in the back end of a game. The vibes today were electric, back to what we’ve known throughout this year. That was definitely a great step in the right direction.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Guardians avoided a four-game sweep in the series with their MLB-leading 37th comeback win.
Kansas City had its seven-game road winning streak snapped and is 23-14 since the All-Star break.
Wacha was denied his 100th career win, pitching six-plus innings and allowing five runs.
